intro: Gastrolobium papilio, commonly known as the pink wattle, is a flowering plant native to Western Australia. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, characterized by its pod-like fruits and nitrogen-fixing capabilities. The plant features compound leaves with small, rounded leaflets and produces striking pink to purple flowers. It thrives in sandy soils and is often found in coastal and dry inland regions. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is cultivated in gardens and conservation areas.
